page.title: 15LEISURE IN BOSLEY
page.content: The village offers few leisure facilities for children or adults. There is no recreation ground or local football pitch .The children are taught swimming at school.Most go swimming in their own time but have to travel at least 5 miles to the nearest bath in Macclesfield.Other swimming baths used are Congleton, Biddulph,Leek and Buxton.All children watch television for at least an hour and up to 4 hours in the winter.The chapel runs a club for the 10 to 14 years but there are no other organised activities for young people.The nearest Brownie group is at Sutton,and the nearest Scout group at Buglawton both about 4 miles away.There is an adult fishing club .The two pubs organise darts matches and clay pigeon shoots.Aerobic classes are held in school.
